summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling its resolution 1291 (2000) and other relevant resolutions on the Democratic Republic of the Congo, 
Reaffirming its commitment to the sovereignty, territorial integrity and political independence of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and all States of the region,
Deeply concerned over the continuation of hostilities in the eastern part of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, 
Taking note of the second special report of the Secretary-General of 27 May 2003 and its recommendations,
Reaffirming its readiness to support the peace process through the United Nations Organization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUC),
Decides to extend the mandate of MONUC until 30 July 2003 and 
Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
